The Ptolemies were a Greek-speaking dynasty that ruled Egypt after Alexander the Great conquered it in 332 BCE. Therefore, while Cleopatra was born in Egypt, she was not ethnically Egyptian. 

Cleopatra's father was Ptolemy XII Auletes, a Ptolemaic ruler, and her mother is believed to have been a member of the Ptolemaic dynasty as well. While her lineage was Greek, there may have been some intermarriage with Egyptians over the centuries of Ptolemaic rule in Egypt. However, it is unlikely that her ethnicity was closer to Egyptians than Greeks.

Therefore, the correct answer is (B) no, Cleopatra's ethnicity was not closer to Egyptians than Greeks.
